feed.title: This Strange World
feed.subtitle: The world is a strange place. From creepy conspiracy theories, to weird laws, to terrifying cults, this podcast explores them all. Each week, one of our hosts takes a deep dive into a strange, weird, and random topic, and discusses what they found with the other hosts.

author.name: Gavin Berger, Leah Ettinger, and Chris Ashe

entry.title: Bizarre Crowdfunding Projects - Season 1 Episode 22
entry.content:
Have you ever had a misunderstood idea? Well a lot of people have, and they’ve gotten a shocking amount of money on crowdfunding sites. This week Gavin brings some of the most bizarre crowdfunding projects while Chris and Leah debate the needs for edible cups, meat soap, and a giant inflatable sculpture of Lionel Richie’s head. (Hint: Get in on wacky crowdfunding ideas before they go viral.)

Sources

https://www.forbes.com/sites/ryanrobinson/2017/09/18/crowdfunded-side-projects-that-became-million-dollar-companies/
https://crowdfundingblog.com/most-successful-crowdfunding-projects/
https://www.lifewire.com/weirdest-successful-kickstarter-campaigns-3486133
https://www.businessnewsdaily.com/7925-weirdest-kickstarter-projects.html
https://www.visualcapitalist.com/19-weird-crowdfunding-campaigns-failed/

entry.title: The Pups of U.S. Presidents - Season 1 Episode 21

link.title: The Pups of U.S. Presidents - Season 1 Episode 21

entry.content:
Leah brings us one of her favorite topics to talk about… dogs! More specifically, this week we talk about the famous dogs of the U.S. Presidents, as well as a few other animals that have had the chance to live in the White House. (Hint: Red, White and…Bark? I’m sorry.)

Animal Rescue Resources

https://www.spcai.org/
https://www.aspca.org/
https://bestfriends.org/
https://www.hopeforpaws.org/
https://www.secondchanceanimals.org/

Sources

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/18/world/europe/corgi-dogs-queen-elizabeth.html
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/10/style/biden-german-shepherd-champ-major-rescue.html
https://youtu.be/1AS-dCdYZbo
https://www.bringfido.com/blog/history-of-dogs-in-the-white-house
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_corgis

entry.title: History of Superstitions - Season 1 Episode 20
entry.content:
In honor of Friday the 13th, Chris goes over the history of some famous superstitions while Leah and Gavin continue to knock on wood and throw salt over their shoulder. (Hint: Don’t break any mirrors or walk under any ladders.)

Sources

https://www.insider.com/history-origin-people-superstitions-2018-4
https://www.cracked.com/article_20594_5-shockingly-violent-back-stories-everyday-traditions.html
https://www.rd.com/list/bizarre-origins-of-everyday-superstitions/
https://www.cracked.com/pictofacts-2005-19-origins-everyday-traditions-explained/

entry.title: Bizarre Phobias - Season 1 Episode 19
entry.content:
This week, Gavin talks about some of the most bizarre and unconventional phobias, while Chris and Leah try to guess what they are. (Hint: You can guess along at home!)

entry.title: This Spooky World: Halloween Special - Season 1 Episode 18

link.title: This Spooky World: Halloween Special - Season 1 Episode 18

entry.content:
Spooky season is upon us! And that means it’s time for This Strange World’s first spooky 3-part episode! This episode is jam-packed with spooky content galor! First, Gavin is going to talk about some of the most popular halloween candies, then Chris is going to tell us some urban legends, and finally, Leah is going to talk about some horror movies that were based on real events. So gather some candy, get dressed in your finest costume, and don’t forget to wear a mask, because it’s time for This Spooky World: Halloween Special! (Hint: Boo!)

Topics Timecodes

Gavin - Candy Facts: 05:45
Chris - Urban Legends: 46:49
Leah - Horror Movies based on Real Events: 01:19:32

Sources

https://www.thedailymeal.com/holidays/most-popular-halloween-candies-every-decade-gallery
https://www.delish.com/food-news/g23281676/most-popular-halloween-candy-year-you-were-born/
https://1029thelake.iheart.com/content/2019-10-30-most-popular-halloween-candy-state-by-state-for-2019/
https://www.eatthis.com/popular-halloween-candy-america/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/high-beams/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/the-thing/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/babysitter/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/the-peephole/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/humans-can-lick-too/
https://themorningnews.org/article/the-statue-in-the-corner
https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/arent-you-glad-you-didnt-turn-on-the-light/
2 Sentence Horror Stories - Google Images
https://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/movies/g19738089/horror-movies-based-on-true-stories/
https://youtu.be/qjqh9UVfNNk
https://youtu.be/1KgSp94nCZw

entry.title: Influential Women Throughout History - Season 1 Episode 17

link.title: Influential Women Throughout History - Season 1 Episode 17

entry.content:
Throughout history, women have spoken out fearlessly against racial injustice, sexual injustice, climate change, and many other critical issues to make a difference for the future. In this week’s special episode, Leah discusses ten of the most influential women throughout history. Plus, our friend Kristen Mirand, from ABC 13 WSET in Virginia and a former Ithaca College alum, will join our conversation. (Hint: This is an episode you do not want to miss.)

Sources

https://www.globalcitizen.org/en/content/gender-equality-laws-quotes-ruth-bader-ginsburg/
https://www.marieclaire.co.uk/news/most-inspirational-women-575925
https://helenkellerfoundation.org/about/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emmeline_Pankhurst
https://www.biography.com/activist/emmeline-pankhurst
https://www.history.com/topics/exploration/amelia-earhart
https://www.historynet.com/amelia-earhart
https://www.biographyonline.net/people/diana/achievements_princess_diana.html
https://www.biography.com/activist/rosa-parks
https://www.biography.com/media-figure/oprah-winfrey
https://vocal.media/longevity/oprah-winfreys-greatest-accomplishments
https://www.unwomen.org/en/partnerships/goodwill-ambassadors/emma-watson
https://www.heforshe.org/en/movemen
https://time.com/person-of-the-year-2019-greta-thunberg/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greta_Thunberg
https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/2014/yousafzai/facts/
https://time.com/4402630/malala-yousafzai-accomplishments/

entry.title: Bizarre US Elections - Season 1 Episode 16
entry.content:
We’re living in pretty strange times to say the least, and while we may be going through one of the most bizarre US elections in American history, it hasn’t always been smooth. Gavin brings in some stories of elections past and even some weird political candidates you wouldn’t expect, while Chris and Leah narrow down their top parody candidates. Plus our political expert Madison is here to help translate political jargon. It’s a fun time. (Hint: MAKE SURE YOU ARE REGISTERED TO VOTE.)

Voting is an important part of our democracy, and this year is especially important. There are a lot of resources to help you become knowledgeable on the candidates and get registered to vote, but we have provided a few of our favorites. Please, please, please, register to vote, and don’t forget to check early voting deadlines in your state or take the necessary precautions to vote in person.

Voting Resources

https://www.vote.org/
https://votesaveamerica.com/
https://www.whenweallvote.org/

Sources

https://www.cnn.com/2015/10/30/politics/interesting-u-s-elections/index.html

entry.title: Bizarre Man-Made Disasters - Season 1 Episode 15
entry.content:
Chris brings some bizarre man-made disasters to discuss after having so much fun with the bizarre natural phenomena episode, while Gavin and Leah try to comprehend just how horrible humanity truly is. (Hint: Humanity needs to be nicer to the environment.)

Sources

https://youtu.be/RMNo7IwwXDQ
https://www.businessinsider.com/the-biggest-man-made-disasters-2019-5
https://www.bu.edu/sustainability/minamata-disease/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perfluorooctanoic_acid
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Chicago_Fire

entry.title: SCP Foundation Part 2 - Season 1 Episode 14
entry.content:
This episode contains strong themes and may not be suitable for younger listeners.

Leah discusses some more of her favorite spooky SCPs in our second SCP Foundation episode, while Gavin and Chris try to rationalize these loveable yet scary creations. (Hint: You probably shouldn’t listen to this one late at night either.)

Sources

https://scpcb.gamepedia.com/
http://www.scp-wiki.net/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SCP_Foundation
http://www.scpwiki.com/scp-1544/comments/show
http://www.scpwiki.com/scp-4999

entry.title: The Mandela Effect - Season 1 Episode 13
entry.content:
Gavin brings in some mind bending examples of one of his favorite conspiracy theories, The Mandela Effect, while Leah tries not to fall into a parallel dimension and Chris reevaluates his life. (Hint: This episode may cause you to reconsider everything you once knew to be real.)

Sources

https://www.verywellmind.com/what-is-the-mandela-effect-4589394
http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/False_memory
https://www.healthline.com/health/mental-health/mandela-effect
https://www.mentalfloss.com/article/585887/mandela-effect-examples
https://www.buzzfeed.com/christopherhudspeth/crazy-examples-of-the-mandela-effect-that-will-make-you-ques
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=04854XqcfCY
